skill.name: changelog-generator
skill.description: Automatically creates user-facing changelogs from git commits by analyzing commit history, categorizing changes, and transforming technical commits into clear, customer-friendly release notes. Turns hours of manual changelog writing into minutes of automated generation.
skill.summary: Transforms git commits into polished, user-friendly changelogs that customers understand.
skill.author: davila7

security_audit.summary: All static findings are false positives. The network URL is legitimate GitHub metadata. The detected 'weak cryptographic algorithms' are actually SHA256 hashes for file integrity. The 'shell backtick execution' patterns are Markdown code block delimiters, not actual command execution. This skill processes git history to generate documentation with no security concerns.

content.value_statement: Manually writing changelogs from git commits is time-consuming and error-prone. This skill analyzes your commit history, categorizes changes automatically, and produces polished release notes that customers can understand.
actual_capabilities: Scans git history from a specific time period or between versions
Categorizes commits into features, improvements, bug fixes, breaking changes, and security updates
Translates technical commit messages into customer-friendly language
Excludes internal commits like refactoring and test updates
Formats output with clear structure and emoji indicators
Supports custom style guidelines via CHANGELOG_STYLE.md
limitations: Does not execute git commands directly; works with provided commit data
Cannot access private repositories without proper authentication
Output quality depends on commit message quality and consistency
May require manual review for complex or ambiguous commits

use_cases.title: Create Release Notes for Software Updates
use_cases.description: Generate professional release notes for software launches. Perfect for product teams preparing customer-facing update announcements.

use_cases.title: Write App Store Update Descriptions
use_cases.description: Create clear, concise update descriptions for mobile app stores. Transform technical changes into benefits that users appreciate.

use_cases.title: Maintain Public Changelog Pages
use_cases.description: Keep your public changelog updated automatically. Generate weekly or monthly summaries for your documentation website.

prompt_templates.title: Basic Changelog from Recent Commits
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a changelog from all commits since the last release. Group changes into categories like new features, improvements, bug fixes, and breaking changes. Write in a customer-friendly tone.
prompt_templates.scenario: Generate a complete changelog for a release

prompt_templates.title: Changelog with Date Range
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate a changelog for all commits between March 1 and March 15. Focus on changes visible to users. Exclude internal refactoring and test commits.
prompt_templates.scenario: Create a changelog for a specific time period

prompt_templates.title: Version-Based Release Notes
prompt_templates.prompt: Create release notes for version 2.5.0. Include all commits since v2.4.0. Format with clear headings and emphasize user-facing improvements.
prompt_templates.scenario: Generate release notes for a specific version

prompt_templates.title: Custom Style Changelog
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a changelog for commits since v2.4.0. Follow the guidelines in CHANGELOG_STYLE.md for tone, formatting, and structure. Use brand-voice language.
prompt_templates.scenario: Generate a changelog with custom styling

output_examples.input: Create a changelog for commits from the past 7 days
output: - **Team Workspaces**: Create separate workspaces for different projects. Invite team members and keep everything organized.
- **Keyboard Shortcuts**: Press ? to see all available shortcuts. Navigate faster without touching your mouse.
- **Faster Sync**: Files now sync 2x faster across devices
- **Better Search**: Search now includes file contents, not just titles
- Fixed issue where large images would not upload
- Resolved timezone confusion in scheduled posts
- Updated API authentication. See migration guide at /docs/migration.md
- Dark mode support for all interfaces
- Enhanced password hashing for user accounts

best_practices: Use descriptive commit messages to improve changelog quality
Run the skill from your git repository root directory
Review generated output before publishing to customers
Maintain a CHANGELOG_STYLE.md for consistent voice and formatting
anti_patterns: Publishing raw git commit output without translation
Including internal commits like refactoring and test updates
Skipping the review step before publishing release notes
Using technical jargon that customers cannot understand

faq.question: What git commands does this skill use?
faq.answer: The skill works with commit data provided to it. It analyzes commit history, extracts meaningful changes, and transforms them into user-friendly language.

faq.question: Can I customize the output format?
faq.answer: Yes. Create a CHANGELOG_STYLE.md file in your repository with your formatting guidelines and custom style preferences.

faq.question: Does this skill work with private repositories?
faq.answer: Access depends on your authentication setup. The skill processes commit data that is provided to it.

faq.question: How does the skill handle ambiguous commit messages?
faq.answer: Commits with unclear messages may appear in a general category or require manual review. Writing clear commit messages improves results.

faq.question: Can I exclude specific types of commits?
faq.answer: Yes. Specify which commit types to exclude in your prompt, such as refactoring, test updates, or internal documentation changes.

faq.question: What categories does the skill use?
faq.answer: Default categories include New Features, Improvements, Bug Fixes, Breaking Changes, and Security Updates. Custom categories can be defined in CHANGELOG_STYLE.md.
